name: Thick Hide
description: Increases Defense by 5.
scientificFact: Large dinosaurs had thick skin that provided protection from minor injuries and biting insects.

name: Sharp Claws
description: Increases Attack by 5.
scientificFact: Dromaeosaurid claws were curved and sharp, perfect for gripping and slashing prey.

name: Endurance
description: Increases Max Stamina by 20.
scientificFact: Ornithomimids were built for sustained running rather than short sprints.

name: Vitality
description: Increases Max HP by 20.
scientificFact: Larger dinosaurs had greater vitality and could survive serious injuries.

name: Swift Reflexes
description: Increases Speed by 5.
scientificFact: Smaller theropods had quick reflexes to catch agile prey.

name: Ambush Predator
description: Start combat with +10 Attack for the first turn.
scientificFact: Many predators relied on ambush tactics to catch faster prey unaware.

name: Regeneration
description: Heal 5 HP at the start of each turn.
scientificFact: Dinosaur bones show evidence of healed injuries, indicating robust regenerative abilities.

name: Vampiric Bite
description: Heal for 20% of damage dealt.
scientificFact: Predators gained energy and nutrition from consuming prey during and after hunts.

name: Thorned Skin
description: Reflect 5 damage back to attacker when hit.
scientificFact: Ankylosaurs had osteoderms with keeled ridges that could injure attackers.

name: Stunning Roar
description: 10% chance to stun enemy on attack.
scientificFact: Large theropods likely produced deep, resonating vocalizations that could startle prey.

name: Serrated Teeth
description: 20% chance to cause bleeding on attack.
scientificFact: Theropod teeth were often serrated like steak knives for slicing through flesh.

name: Scavenger
description: Heal 20 HP when defeating an enemy.
scientificFact: Even apex predators like T. rex would scavenge when the opportunity arose.

name: Adrenaline
description: Gain +10 Attack when below 30% HP.
scientificFact: Fight-or-flight responses in dinosaurs likely triggered hormone surges similar to modern reptiles.

name: Iron Scales
description: Reduce incoming damage by 3.
scientificFact: Crocodilian-like scales provided additional armor for some dinosaurs and their relatives.

name: Apex Predator
description: Deal 20% more damage to Elite and Boss enemies.
scientificFact: Apex predators like T. rex had no natural predators when fully grown.

name: Pack Tactics
description: +15% damage when you have allies in combat.
scientificFact: Dromaeosaurids likely hunted in groups to take down prey larger than themselves.

name: Intimidating Presence
description: 20% chance enemies skip their turn in fear.
scientificFact: Large predators often relied on intimidation to avoid unnecessary combat.

name: Herbivore's Strength
description: +20% health from healing effects.
scientificFact: Herbivorous dinosaurs often had robust digestive systems that processed tough plant matter efficiently.

name: Predator's Instinct
description: +30% critical hit chance against targets below 30% health.
scientificFact: Predators target weakened or injured prey to minimize risk of injury to themselves.

name: Armored Body
description: Reduce all incoming physical damage by 15%.
scientificFact: Thyreophoran dinosaurs developed extensive body armor as defense against predators.

name: Feathered Coat
description: Immune to cold environmental effects. +1 evasion.
scientificFact: Feathers evolved for insulation before they were adapted for flight.

name: Hollow Bones
description: +3 speed but -10 max health.
scientificFact: Pterosaurs and birds have hollow, pneumatic bones that reduce weight for flight.

name: Alpha Status
description: Allies deal +10% damage and gain +1 defense while you're alive.
scientificFact: Social dinosaurs likely had hierarchy systems similar to modern wolves and lions.

name: Nocturnal Hunter
description: +25% damage during night encounters.
scientificFact: Some dinosaurs like Troodon had large eyes adapted for hunting in low light conditions.

name: Dense Bones
description: +3 defense but -1 speed. Resistant to bone-breaking attacks.
scientificFact: Spinosaurus had unusually dense bones to help it sink and hunt underwater.

name: Conical Teeth
description: +20% damage against aquatic enemies.
scientificFact: Spinosaurids had conical teeth perfect for gripping slippery fish.

name: Impressive Horns
description: Charge attacks deal +25% damage.
scientificFact: Ceratopsian horns were used for both defense and intraspecific combat.

name: Sail-Backed
description: Immune to temperature extremes. Can intimidate smaller enemies automatically.
scientificFact: Spinosaurus' sail may have been used for thermoregulation, display, or fat storage.

name: Club Tail
description: Counter attacks deal 50% more damage. Can stun attackers.
scientificFact: Ankylosaurus' tail club could swing with tremendous force, capable of breaking predator bones.

name: Dome Skull
description: Immune to stun effects. Headbutt attacks deal +30% damage.
scientificFact: Pachycephalosaurus had a skull dome up to 25cm thick of solid bone.

name: Resonating Crest
description: Sonic abilities have +25% effectiveness.
scientificFact: Parasaurolophus' hollow crest could produce sounds that traveled for kilometers.

name: Heightened Senses
description: Cannot be surprised. Detect hidden enemies and traps.
scientificFact: Predatory dinosaurs had keen senses of smell, sight, and hearing.

name: Binocular Vision
description: +15% accuracy and +10% critical hit chance.
scientificFact: T. rex had forward-facing eyes with overlapping fields of view for depth perception.

name: Keen Smell
description: Detect wounded enemies. +15% damage against bleeding targets.
scientificFact: T. rex's olfactory bulbs were enormous, giving it a sense of smell comparable to vultures.

name: Endurance Runner
description: Stamina costs reduced by 15%. Regenerate 5 stamina per turn.
scientificFact: Ornithomimids were built for sustained running rather than short sprints.

name: Vestigial Arms
description: +10% bite damage but cannot use grappling abilities.
scientificFact: Carnotaurus had the shortest arms of any large theropod relative to body size.

name: Gigantothermy
description: Immune to temperature effects. Maintain constant body temperature.
scientificFact: Large dinosaurs maintained stable body temperatures through their mass alone.

name: Herd Instinct
description: +2 defense when you have allies.
scientificFact: Herding behavior provided protection from predators through safety in numbers.

name: Venomous
description: Attacks have 20% chance to poison (3 damage per turn for 4 turns).
scientificFact: Some theropods like Sinornithosaurus may have had venomous bites, though this is debated.

name: Territorial
description: +20% damage when defending your territory (home biome).
scientificFact: Many dinosaurs were highly territorial, as evidenced by combat injuries between members of the same species.

name: Aquatic Adaptation
description: +30% all stats in water terrain.
scientificFact: Spinosaurus had dense bones and a paddle tail for swimming.

name: Opportunistic Feeder
description: Heal 10% of damage dealt.
scientificFact: Most carnivorous dinosaurs were opportunistic, eating whatever was available.

name: Brood Parent
description: Allies gain +15% max health.
scientificFact: Many dinosaurs including Maiasaura showed extensive parental care of their young.

name: Migratory
description: Reduced stamina cost for travel. Bonus to exploration rewards.
scientificFact: Evidence suggests some dinosaurs migrated seasonally to follow food sources.

name: Colonial Nester
description: Bonus to rest healing when near other dinosaurs.
scientificFact: Many dinosaurs nested in colonies for protection, like modern seabirds.

name: Rapid Growth
description: +25% experience gain.
scientificFact: Many dinosaurs grew rapidly during adolescence, reaching adult size quickly.

name: Primitive Feathers
description: Resist cold damage. Better camouflage in forested areas.
scientificFact: Proto-feathers evolved before true flight feathers, providing insulation.

name: Bone-Breaking Bite
description: Critical hits permanently reduce target's max health by 5.
scientificFact: T. rex could bite with 12,800 pounds of force, crushing bone into splinters.

name: Living Fossil
description: Ancient lineage grants wisdom. +10% to all stats.
scientificFact: Some lineages persisted for tens of millions of years, well-adapted to their niches.

name: Extinction Survivor
description: Survive fatal damage once per run with 1 HP. Immune to instant-death effects.
scientificFact: Some dinosaur lineages survived multiple extinction events before the final K-Pg catastrophe.

name: Sickle Claw
description: Critical hits cause bleeding. +20% crit damage.
scientificFact: Dromaeosaurids' enlarged toe claws were used for slashing and gripping prey.

name: Natural Camouflage
description: 25% chance to avoid being targeted in multi-enemy encounters.
scientificFact: Many dinosaurs likely had countershading or disruptive coloration for camouflage.

name: Thermoregulation
description: Bonus stats in hot environments. Penalty in cold.
scientificFact: Reptiles require external heat sources to maintain optimal body temperature.

name: Battle Scarred
description: +3 defense permanently but -5 max HP. Intimidates enemies.
scientificFact: Fossil evidence shows many dinosaurs survived serious combat injuries, indicating fierce battles.

name: Ancient Wisdom
description: Learn from encounters: gain +1% stats after each combat (stacks 10 times).
scientificFact: Dinosaurs that lived longer likely learned to navigate threats more effectively.
